availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremy H. Lennin (Butler County, Kentucky, clergyman and captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Butler County, Kentucky, minister and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Amanda Lennin. Father of Emma D. Lennin. Methodist Episcopal clergyman in Butler County in 1860. Served in the 53rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from October 31, 1864, to September 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Butler County, p. 869.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0457.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 529.
